answers.answer: Yes if u have history of preclampsia they will consider u high risk
Yes if u have history of preclampsia they will consider u high risk
Thanks. I wasn't sure because on my print outs that I get after my appointment it always says "supervision of normal pregnancy " however they did say I would need to be closely monitored.

I had m.c. a lot and ended up pregnant again without trying I am considered high risk im on bed rest but hopefully now that I am in my second trimester and everything is okay with the baby they will let me get back to working. It's boring if the put you on bed rest just try to relax when ever you have the time to take naps eat right. Good luck

I'm high risk for several reasons I have had a lot of bleeding and been really ill with one thing or another during the pregnancy the doctors keep putting me on bed rest and all my notes state high risk x

Well good luck to all of you. I'm a bit afraid,  I read into stuff too much after I'm told about it and I didn't realize how many complications come along with gest diabetes. My mom had it with her 4 kids after she had me and I remember they were all huhlge and my sis had low blood sugar and had to stay I'm the hospital a week after my mom was discharged but I didn't know that there were so many other things as well.

question: What do they consider as being a high risk pregnancy? I have been diagnosed with gestational diabetes and have read that it increases your chance of getting preeclampsia. I had preeclampsia with my last baby and was induced when they caught it at 39+3weeks. Am I in the high risk category?
title: high risk??
